articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bitcoin has broken above $40,000 for the first time this year as it rides a wave of momentum on broad enthusiasm about U.S. interest rate cuts and as traders anticipate the imminent approval of U.S.-stockmarket traded bitcoin funds.
articles.title: Bitcoin breaks $40,000 as momentum builds

articles.author: Julia Payne
articles.description: Electric vehicle drivers hoping to top up their batteries at one of Repsol's (REP.MC) 1,600 Spanish charging stations might well be disappointed, with nearly half lying dormant because they have no power connection.
articles.title: EV charging growth plans slowed by EU's power grid problems

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Toyota Motor (7203.T) said on Monday it would increase its line-up of battery electric vehicles in Europe to six models by 2026 and it expected such vehicles to make up more than 20% of new car sales in the region by then.
articles.title: Toyota plans to expand battery EV line-up in Europe to 6 models by 2026

articles.author: Shivam Patel
articles.description: Indian tests of a cough syrup linked to the deaths of at least six children in Cameroon have found unidentified quality issues in at least one of the five samples picked up by authorities, two people familiar with the investigation told Reuters.
articles.title: India finds quality issues with cough syrup linked to Cameroon deaths - sources

articles.author: Ludwig Burger, Noele Illien
articles.description: Roche (ROG.S) agreed to take over obesity drug developer Carmot Therapeutics (CRMO.O) for $2.7 billion, joining a list global contestants seeking to challenge the dominant makers of weight-loss drugs Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO) and Eli Lilly.
articles.title: Roche enters obesity drug market with $2.7 bln Carmot deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. officials plan to visit Taiwan to explain to companies details of new curbs, primarily aimed at China, on advanced chip exports, the island's economy minister said on Monday.
articles.title: US officials to visit Taiwan to explain chip curbs, minister says

articles.author: Krystal Hu, Ira Iosebashvili
articles.description: An attack on an American warship and commercial vessels in the Red Sea on Sunday risks reigniting investor worries about a widening of the war between Israel and Hamas, potentially complicating the outlook for a rally that saw U.S. stocks crest a fresh closing high for the year last week.
articles.title: U.S. stock rally could wobble after Red Sea attacks

articles.author: Arafat Barbakh, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli ground forces were confronting Hamas fighters across the Gaza Strip, the Israeli military said on Sunday in its clearest indication yet that a planned ground offensive in the enclave's refugee-crowded south had begun as Israeli bombing killed and wounded dozens of Palestinians.
articles.title: Israel says ground forces operating across Gaza Strip as offensive builds

articles.author: Ernest Scheyder
articles.description: Start-up tech firms are racing to transform the way rare earths are refined for the clean energy transition, a push aimed at turbocharging the West's expansion into the niche sector that underpins billions of electronic devices.
articles.title: Western start-ups seek to break China's grip on rare earths refining

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spotify (SPOT.N) will reduce its total headcount by around 17% across the company, it said in an email on Monday, after laying of 6% of this staff in January citing higher costs.
articles.title: Spotify to reduce staff by 17% in second layoff this year
